intro: Aporum korthalsii, commonly known as the Korthals' ivy, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by berries containing seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a houseplant in many parts of the world.
